description:
Possibly the best game engine I've used. Great graphics(note: you have to adjust settings yourself), no online account required and is very extensible.

GDScript is also a very easy to learn language, although I don't like how it doesn't have error handling(functions return null instead of error-ing out).
summary: A great and lightweight game engine

description: The first somewhat big Game-Engine that works flawlessly without any hassle on Linux

One of the absolute best game engines out there. Widely considered to be roughly on par with Unity and Unreal Engine, but with an absolutely tiny filesize by comparison, intuitive tools, and low system requirements.

This is an engine that you can use to create proper, professional games. One of the only reasons it isn't frequently used for this, though, has been issues with its 3D engine and licensing, but - as of 4.0 - this is by far one of the best engines out there. Not only that, but it's FOSS, and has a community that doesn't actively screw over its users, so score one over Unity.

Genuinely, pick this up and try it out. Even if you aren't a game designer, Godot is a surprisingly useful tool for program design in general. I often find myself designing assets for a godot game using art programs, modeling programs, etc. that were themselves made in the Godot engine.
Happy to see this ENGINE in the App Center

This is a amazing open source protect, and I would suggest checking it out. The engine itself is very easy to use and is very light, it also supports many different scripting languages. The engine is arguably much better suited for 2D games, but the 3D side is being worked on. This engine is also available on Steam, and I'd suggest getting it there.
Пока что в нем меньше функционала, но с учетом темпов развития оно точно быстро обгонит остальные движки.
